attributes.action: accept that humour is part of the "British Way of Life" and not to reject petitions that are "intended to be humorous, or have no point about government policy"
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Rejecting a petition just because it is intended to be humorous is a disgrace at a time when the Government is seeking to promote "British Values" which must surely include the celebrated "British Sense of Humour"

OK, so lack of a point about government policy may seem a reasonable ground for rejection.  But lets have a bit of latitude.   In 1998 it was reported, "Prime Minister Tony Blair has promised to intervene" in the entirely fictional case of a Deirdre Rachid - a character in the Soap Coronation Street

reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
